moves.3. Bc4: A move that i perfected long ago.
moves.4... d5: Black tries to block off the attack.
moves.5... b5: Surprise! A very affective move, most people played how my opponent played here. White is expecting you to play Na5.
moves.6... Qxd5: Attacking the g2 pawn and the bishop.
moves.10... h6 11. Ne4 Nxe4 12. dxe4: Probably better was fxe4 because that can lead to an attack on my king.
moves.12... Bc5+: Found a way to win his rook.
moves.14. Bd2: There is no reason to save the rook because you can't.
moves.16. b3 O-O 17. Qc4: Pinning my queen, but it doesn't do much.
moves.17... Qd6: Now i'm not letting him develop his knight.
moves.18. Qe2: Trying to let the knight develop.
moves.19. a3: This move made him lose, better was Qc4.
moves.19... Qd4: The winning move. Threatning the rook, and the mate on g1.
moves.20. Nc3: The only way to survive, but had to give a bishop.
moves.22. Na4: Not sure why he did this.
moves.23. Nxc5: The rest of the game was just plane easy.
And now he resinged because there is mate in two. What a crushing game!
